001package gust.backend.driver.inmemory;
002
003import com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningScheduledExecutorService;
004import com.google.errorprone.annotations.CanIgnoreReturnValue;
005import com.google.protobuf.Message;
006import gust.backend.model.*;
007import gust.backend.runtime.Logging;
008import gust.backend.runtime.ReactiveFuture;
009import org.slf4j.Logger;
010import tools.elide.core.DatapointType;
011
012import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
013import javax.annotation.Nullable;
014import javax.annotation.concurrent.Immutable;
015import java.util.Objects;
016import java.util.Optional;
017import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
018import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap;
019
020import static gust.backend.model.ModelMetadata.*;
021
022
023/**
024 * Proxies calls to a static concurrent map, held by a private singleton. This nicely supplies local entity storage for
025 * simple testing and mocking purposes. Please do not use this in production. The in-memory data engine does not support
026 * queries, persistence, or nearly anything except get/put/delete.
027 *
028 * @param <Model> Model/message type which we are storing with this driver.
029 */
030@SuppressWarnings("UnstableApiUsage")
031public final class InMemoryDriver<Key extends Message, Model extends Message>
032  implements PersistenceDriver<Key, Model, EncodedModel> {
033  /** Private logging pipe. */
034  private static final Logger logging = Logging.logger(InMemoryStorage.class);
035
036  /** Codec to use for model serialization/de-serialization. */
037  private final @Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, EncodedModel> codec;
038
039  /** Executor service to use for storage calls. */
040  private final @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService;
041
042  /** Holds private "data storage" via in-memory concurrent map. */
043  @Immutable
044  private final static class InMemoryStorage {
045    /** Storage singleton instance. */
046    private final static InMemoryStorage INSTANCE;
047
048    /** Backing storage map. */
049    private final @Nonnull ConcurrentMap<Object, EncodedModel> storageMap;
050
051    static {
052      INSTANCE = new InMemoryStorage();
053    }
054
055    /** Private constructor. Acquire via {@link #acquire()}. */
056    private InMemoryStorage() {
057      storageMap = new ConcurrentSkipListMap<>();
058    }
059
060    /** @return In-memory storage window singleton. */
061    @CanIgnoreReturnValue
062    private static @Nonnull ConcurrentMap<Object, EncodedModel> acquire() {
063      return INSTANCE.storageMap;
064    }
065  }
066
067  /**
068   * Construct a new in-memory driver from scratch. This constructor is private to force use of static factory methods
069   * also defined on this class.
070   *
071   * @param codec Codec to use when serializing and de-serializing models with this driver.
072   * @param executorService Executor service to run against.
073   */
074  private InMemoryDriver(@Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, EncodedModel> codec,
075                         @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService) {
076    this.codec = codec;
077    this.executorService = executorService;
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Acquire an in-memory driver instance for the provided model type and builder. Although the driver object itself is
082   * created for the purpose, it accesses a static concurrent map backing all in-memory driver instances to facilitate
083   * storage.
084   *
085   * <p>It is generally recommended to acquire an instance of this driver through the adapter instead. This can be
086   * accomplished via {@link InMemoryAdapter#acquire(Message, Message, Optional, ListeningScheduledExecutorService)},
087   * followed by {@link InMemoryAdapter#engine()}.</p>
088   *
089   * @see InMemoryAdapter#acquire(Message, Message, ListeningScheduledExecutorService) to acquire a full adapter.
090   * @param <K> Key type to specify for the attached model type.
091   * @param <M> Model/message type for which we should return an in-memory storage driver.
092   * @param codec Codec to use when serializing and de-serializing models with this driver.
093   * @param executorService Executor service to use for storage calls.
094   * @return In-memory driver instance created for the specified message type.
095   */
096  static @Nonnull <K extends Message, M extends Message> InMemoryDriver<K, M> acquire(
097    @Nonnull ModelCodec<M, EncodedModel> codec,
098    @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService) {
099    return new InMemoryDriver<>(codec, executorService);
100  }
101
102  // -- Getters -- //
103  /** {@inheritDoc} */
104  @Override
105  public @Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, EncodedModel> codec() {
106    return this.codec;
107  }
108
109  /** {@inheritDoc} */
110  @Override
111  public @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService() {
112    return this.executorService;
113  }
114
115  // -- API: Fetch -- //
116  /** {@inheritDoc} */
117  @Override
118  public @Nonnull ReactiveFuture<Optional<Model>> retrieve(final @Nonnull Key key,
119                                                           final @Nonnull FetchOptions options) {
120    Objects.requireNonNull(key, "Cannot fetch model with `null` for key.");
121    Objects.requireNonNull(options, "Cannot fetch model without `options`.");
122    enforceRole(key, DatapointType.OBJECT_KEY);
123    var id = id(key).orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot fetch model with empty key."));
124
125    return ReactiveFuture.wrap(this.executorService.submit(() -> {
126      EncodedModel data = InMemoryStorage.acquire().get(id);
127      if (data != null) {
128        // we found encoded data at the provided key. inflate it with the codec.
129        return Optional.of(applyMask(this.codec.deserialize(data), options));
130      } else {
131        // the model was not found.
132        return Optional.empty();
133      }
134    }), options.executorService().orElse(this.executorService));
135  }
136
137  // -- API: Persist -- //
138  /** {@inheritDoc} */
139  @Override
140  public @Nonnull ReactiveFuture<Model> persist(final @Nullable Key key,
141                                                final @Nonnull Model model,
142                                                final @Nonnull WriteOptions options) {
143    Objects.requireNonNull(model, "Cannot persist `null` model.");
144    Objects.requireNonNull(options, "Cannot persist model without `options`.");
145
146    return ReactiveFuture.wrap(this.executorService.submit(() -> {
147      // resolve target key, and then write mode
148      @Nonnull Message targetKey = key != null ? key : generateKey(model);
149      //noinspection OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent
150      @Nonnull Object targetId = id(targetKey).get();
151
152      WriteOptions.WriteDisposition writeMode = (
153        key == null ? WriteOptions.WriteDisposition.MUST_NOT_EXIST : options.writeMode());
154
155      // enforce write mode
156      boolean conflictFailure = false;
157      switch (writeMode) {
158        case MUST_NOT_EXIST: conflictFailure = InMemoryStorage.acquire().containsKey(targetId); break;
159        case MUST_EXIST: conflictFailure = !InMemoryStorage.acquire().containsKey(targetId); break;
160        case BLIND: break;
161      }
162      if (conflictFailure) {
163        logging.error(String.format(
164          "Encountered conflict failure: key collision at ID '%s'.", targetId));
165        throw new ModelWriteConflict(targetId, model, writeMode);
166      }
167
168      // if we make it this far, we're ready to write. serialize and put.
169      InMemoryStorage
170        .acquire()
171        .put(targetId, codec.serialize(model));
172
173      return spliceKey(model, Optional.of(targetKey));
174    }), options.executorService().orElse(this.executorService));
175  }
176}
